title: Airlie 2014 Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)
description: This wine seems awkward—there is no other way to put it. Unintegrated, lumbery oak flavors jut out in front of brambly berry fruit. Nothing hangs together and the oak treatment is rough and outsized.

title: Bodegas Alejandro Fernandez 2014 Alejairén Airen (La Mancha)
description: This golden oak-aged Airén smells almost entirely of wood grain and vanilla. On the palate, it's resiny to an extreme. Flavors of raw wood and coconut are devoid of fruit, while this tastes like liquid oak on the finish.

title: Merriam 2014 Bacigalupi Vineyard Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)
description: This wine is somewhat dull in texture and elusive in fruit, offering a strong sense of oak and sulfur.

title: Torres 2014 Milmanda Chardonnay (Conca de Barberà)
description: The nose of this wine is melony and chunky, with a touch of oak. The palate feels solid enough but still a bit mushy, while dry, creamy flavors of tropical fruits are diffuse in front of a finish that's low in verve.

title: Whitetail Ridge 2014 Valo White (Umpqua Valley)
description: This wine is already past its prime. The blend of Müller-Thurgau, Viognier and Moscato is interesting, but the fruit is fading into a simple, lightly peachy syrup, with a hint of plastic. Drink now.

title: Albada 2014 Viñas Viejas Garnacha (Calatayud)
description: Raisiny, saucy aromas are slightly volatile. A wide, saturated palate comes up short on focus and acidity, while a mix of raisin and green-herb flavors lands on a heavy finish.

title: Methven Family Vineyards 2014 Estate Cuvée Pinot Noir (Eola-Amity Hills)
description: As most Methven Pinots are estate grown, it's not entirely clear what distinguishes this from the others. What it does show, rather agressively, are aromas of leather. Those same flavors render the wine thin, astringent and bitter, amplifying the drying tannins.

title: Madrigal 2014 Petite Sirah (Napa Valley)
description: This wine is slightly bittersweet and off-putting, with a dullness to the texture.

title: Gaja 2014  Barbaresco
description: This isn't just a great wine for what was a notoriously cool, wet vintage, it's quite simply a magnificent wine. Perfumed and loaded with finesse, it opens with scents of woodland berry, iris and baking spice while the vibrant, balanced palate doles out Marasca cherry, dark culinary spice, crushed herb and menthol. Refined tannins and fresh acidity provide the taut framework while a licorice note wraps around the finish. Gorgeous. Drink 2022–2034.

title: Gaja 2014 Costa Russi  (Barbaresco)
description: Intense scents of cherry, star anise and iris float out of the glass. It's firmly structured and loaded with finesse, offering crushed raspberry, Marasca cherry, cinnamon and star anise framed fine-grained tannins. Bright acidity lends balance and energy.

title: Crown Point 2014 Cabernet Sauvignon (Happy Canyon of Santa Barbara)
description: A deep, velvety purple color in the glass, this bottling by proprietor Roger Bower and winemaker Adam Henkel shows dark-chocolate-covered black cherries, fresh blackberry, white pepper, violet oil, port reduction sauce and spice sake on the lavish nose. Firm tannins frame the palate, which carries black currant and roasted lean beef flavors through soy and pepper sauce into a finish of caramel and espresso grinds.

title: Daou 2014 Soul of a Lion Red (Adelaida District)
description: A sultry shade of dark purple, this luxury bottling by the Daou brothers shows freshly smashed black currant, gravelly minerality, black pepper, espresso and shaved chocolate on the nose. The palate is black to the core, from blueberry to dark chocolate to lava rocks, with strong yet polished tannins and wel-balanced acidity. Decant now or drink 2020–2035.

title: Crown Point 2014 Estate Selection Limited Production Red (Happy Canyon of Santa Barbara)
description: Extremely dense in the glass, this epic bottling offers lavish and penetrating aromas of black currant and elderberry jam on the nose alongside seared beef, chocolate cake and a pinch of violet. Expertly balanced, polished tannins make for a soft mouthfeel yet firm structure, carrying flavors of black fruit, chocolate and grilled figs that lead to an espresso note on the finish.

title: Hall 2014 Cabernet Sauvignon (Diamond Mountain District)
description: Deliciously crafted and full-bodied ripe, this shows dense layers of blackberry and blueberry crumble succulence and richness, well-etched flavors that are wrapped in soft integrated oak. Juicy and earthy, it offers length and breadth, the tannins roundly structured. Memorable seasonings include chocolate and clove. Enjoy best 2024–2034.

title: Fontodi 2014 Vigna del Sorbo Gran Selezione  (Chianti Classico)
description: Exotic spice, pipe tobacco, dark-skinned berry, forest floor and a whiff of French oak all come together on this structured red. The elegant, full-bodied palate evokes Marasca cherry, black raspberry, licorice and white pepper while vibrant acidity and firm, fine-grained tannins provide balance. It's still young, with great energy and will benefit from more time in the bottle. Drink 2020–2029.

title: Cinnabar 2014 Malbec (Red Hills Lake County)
description: Combining hyper-concentrated fruit flavors with enticing, sophisticated oak nuances, this wine is a gentle giant. The first thing to notice is the lightly spicy, toasted-baguette aroma, and then the palate floods with saturated, ripe and delicious blackberry and black-cherry flavors, while notes of dark chocolate and black pepper kick in on the finish. This wine ranks with the best yet from Lake County. Best after 2020.

title: Gaja 2014 Sorì Tildin  (Barbaresco)
description: Menthol, pressed rose, woodland berry and crushed herb aromas slowly emerge on this elegant, structured red along with a hint of underbrush. The firm, refined palate delivers Marasca cherry, ground clove and licorice framed in taut, fine-grained tannins. Drink 2022–2034.

title: Hall 2014 Ellie's Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: Softened by 6% Merlot, this is a classically elegant wine, juicy in cranberry, cassis and teases of coffee bean, the tannins broadly etched and brawny in their youth. Integrated oak provides a spiciness of toffee and black licorice, as the aromas develop floral notions of violet as the wine opens in the glass. Enjoy best 2024–2034.

title: Hall 2014 Eighteen Seventy-Three Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: A 100% varietal wine, this is brawny in tannin and big in oak, yet completely beguiling in an underlying delicacy of refined power. Chalky texture that traffics in tobacco and leather overlays elusive fruit and persistent earthiness, a mix of blueberry and blackberry bramble and mountain sage.

title: Fontodi 2014 Flaccianello della Pieve Sangiovese (Colli della Toscana Centrale)
description: Balancing structure and finesse, this full-bodied red delivers aromas and flavors of black-skinned berry, licorice, exotic spice and raspberry compote. Tightly knit, fine-grained tannins and vibrant acidity provide the age-worthy backbone. Drink 2020–2024. Cellar Selection.

title: K Vintners 2014 Royal City Stoneridge Vineyard Syrah (Washington)
description: Coming from the Royal Slope, which no doubt will deservedly have its own appellation before long, enchanting aromas of ground rock, green olive, green stem, crushed flower and dark fruit lead to a panoply of fruit and savory flavors that shake the senses to the core, with smoked meat notes persisting on the long finish. It's an intense experience but maintains a sense of balance that is heart stopping. Drink from 2020-2027.

title: Martinelli 2014 Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)
description: This wine is memorable and impressive—a ripe exploration of earthy goodness that's rich and velvety smooth. Spicy red fruit seduces amidst a well-developed core of complex orange peel and cardamom highlights, the oak well-integrated and supportive.

title: Gaja 2014 Sorì San Lorenzo  (Barbaresco)
description: Forest floor, Porcini mushroom, eucalyptus, dark spice and toasted aromas curl out of the glass. It's youthfully austere, offering cranberry, sour cherry and licorice framed in assertive, close-grained tannins. It still needs time to come around and fully bloom. Drink 2024–2034.

title: K Vintners 2014 Cattle King Upland Vineyard Syrah (Snipes Mountain)
description: Consistently one of the winery's top bottlings, aromas of blackberry, black plum, dried herb, anise and spice are followed by supremely rich, tightly wound black fruit and crème de cassis flavors that show a firm grainy handshake of tannins and a warm crazy-long finish. It's all about intensity of expression but what intensity it brings.

title: K Vintners 2014 Ovide Jack's Vineyard Red (Walla Walla Valley (WA))
description: Coming from a vineyard in the Rocks District, aromas of kirsch, black currant, tobacco, spice and mineral are followed by saturated, rich black fruit and smoked meat flavors. It packs a powerful delicious punch.

title: K Vintners 2014 Powerline Vineyard Syrah (Walla Walla Valley (WA))
description: This new exciting vineyard is located in the foothills of the Blue Mountains and is filled with cobblestone soils. The aromas explode with notes of raspberry, green and black olive brine, green stem, smoked meat, mineral and earth. The palate is rich and focused, with intense earth, fruit and savory flavors that lead to an extended finish. Abundant floral notes are speckled throughout. It's a stunner.

title: Furthermore 2014 Rosella's Vineyard Pinot Noir (Santa Lucia Highlands)
description: Very pretty and precise on the nose, this bottling, which is quite delicate for the rich-leaning region, shows candied pomegranate, cinnamon spice, hibiscus and wet gravel on the nose. Wild strawberry and rhubarb flavors pop on the sip, alongside watermelon rind and a very rocky and tense minerality. There is tons of tannic and acidic depth.

title: Quartz Reef 2014 Bendigo Estate Hielo y Fuego Pinot Noir (Central Otago)
description: Made for the long haul from one of Otago's most highly respected winemakers, Rudi Bauer, this is drinking well now, offering up a heady mix of raisiny red currants, florals, soy sauce, mushrooms and tree sap. It's medium to full bodied, with a line of focused acidity amidst dusty tannins and a long, cumin and herbal finish. Drink now–2027.

title: Undurraga 2014 Altazor Red (Maipo Valley)
description: Ripe, heady aromas of cassis, raisin and spice cake hold nothing back but aren't overdone. The palate is staunch in feel, with firm but manageable tannins, while this tastes of plum, berry fruits and tomato touched by savory oak. The full yet tight finish offers plenty of balance. Drink through 2025.

title: Château de Saint-Cosme 2014 Hominis Fides  (Gigondas)
description: The Hominis Fides represents some of the estate's oldest Grenache vines, with an average age of 90 years. Irresistibly ripe, rich and mouthfilling, this is a powerhouse of black-plum and cherry flavors refined by layers of pencil shavings, cedar and spice. It's bold and lavishly textured yet has freshness and a fine, filigreed tannin structure. Drink now through 2030.
